div.p: The response to request indicates the outcome of processing the request itself - whether it was accepted or rejected, or is still in process. The response resource does not itself convey or represent information that arises as a result of processing the request, but it may have references to other resources that have this information, in order to link between request and outcome.

There may be multiple responses for a given request. For some requests, a responding system may issue a sequence of responses, where each response replaces previous responses as the original request is processed. In these cases, each response should have the same logical identity, and a different version id.
If there are multiple systems responding to the request, or if there request may have multiple responses, then different logical responses should carry different logical ids.
